page.title: 01HOUSING IN THE AREA (part1)
page.content: The older houses are built of stone and have a stone or slate roof.Chimney stacks are of stone with pots of various sizes,shapes and colours.Most houses stand in their own grounds. Smaller detached , semi-detached and rows of houses are built of stone. Many rows of houses are built of brick and have a stone frontage.Nearly all these houses have no land to the front and little to the rear.Houses of this kind usually have a slate roof, stone steps leading to the external doors, cellars,sash windows,metal or wooden gutters and metal fallpipes.More recent detached or semi-detached houses are set back in a small plot of land with a garden to the front and rear.They are constructed of brick and have a tiled or slate roof.These homes have a pantry,internal water closet but no cellars.
